revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2012}} {{Infobox military person |name=Gerald Kellett |birth_date=24 October 1905 |death_date=6 July 1973 |birth_place= |death_place= |image= |caption= |nickname= |allegiance= {{flagicon|United Kingdom}} [[United Kingdom]] |serviceyears=1925–1961 |rank= [[Major general|Major General]] |branch= [[Image:Flag of the British Army.svg|23px]] [[British Army]] |current position= |commands= |unit=[[Royal Artillery]] |battles=[[World War II|Second World War]] |awards=[[Order of the Bath|CB]], [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] |laterwork= }} [[Major general|Major General]] '''Gerald Kellett''' [[Order of the Bath|CB]] [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] (1905–1973) was a senior [[British Army]] officer.
==Biography== Born on 24 October 1905, Gerald Kellett was educated at [[Bedford School]] and at the [[Royal Military Academy, Woolwich]]. He was commissioned as a [[Second lieutenant|Second Lieutenant]] in the [[Royal Artillery]] in 1925. He served during the [[World War II|Second World War]] and was appointed as Director of the Inspectorate of Armaments, between 1954 and 1956, and Director General of Artillery at the [[War Office]], between 1957 and 1960.<ref>[http://www.ukwhoswho.com/view/article/oupww/whowaswho/U156294/KELLETT_Maj.-Gen._Gerald?index=6&results=QuicksearchResults&query=0 Who's Who<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
[[Major general|Major General]] Gerald Kellett was invested as a Commander of the [[Order of the British Empire]] in 1957,<ref>https://www.thegazette.co.uk/London/issue/40960/supplement/7/data.pdf</ref> and as a Companion of the [[Order of the Bath]] in 1959.<ref>https://www.thegazette.co.uk/London/issue/41727/supplement/3699/data.pdf</ref> He retired from the [[British Army]] in January 1961 and died on 6 July 1973.
